data.title: Great sushi but pricey
data.text: I've been hearing about Yume for some time and finally got a chance to dine at this restaurant.  To secure a seating, we have a friend, who went there around noon time to secure 4 seats for a 7 pm seating.  The restaurant only seats 8 at each seating.  Once seated, there was a sign behind the sushi bar that read no pictures are allowed inside.  Hideki was first up on preparing the sushi and his mastery of using the knife was impeccable.  Midway thru the course, they changed chefs and we ended up with 13 pieces.  The use of different ingredients on top of the sushi was excellent.  The sushi from Yume was some of the bests I've tasted in the Bay Area but I found it pretty pricey.  With a beer, tax, and tip, it was over $100.

data.title: Great Food, Horrible Service
data.text:
To all the sycophantic Yume junkies who think this is the ultimate Japanese sushi dining experience, the truth is that this place would not survive in Japan.  It's not that the sushi is not divine--it is!  And it's not that Hideki is not a master craftsman behind the sushi bar, with a good sense of humor and an eclectic taste in music.  He is all of these things!  The reason Yume would not survive in Japan is because of the sheer rudeness and complete lack of class displayed by Hideki's wife.  

And before any of you try to go native on me, here's the deal:  My father was born in Kobe and raised in Yokohama.  And I lived in Tokyo for several years.  So I think I know what I'm talking about when I say that no people take customer service more seriously, and more to heart than the Japanese.  And so, no matter how delicious the sushi might be, Yume would not survive in Japan, because the Japanese people would have no tolerance for that kind of behavior.  None whatsoever.  End of story.

data.title: Best sushi
data.text: The restaurant only serves 8 guests per seating, 5pm, 7.30pm and 9.30pm.  For the 5pm, you have to start queuing at 4pm already.  No reservation policy.  However, once you sink your teeth into the first bite, you feel that it was well worth the wait.  It is that good.  The fish is the freshest you can get.  It is not a restaurant you go to catch up with friends.  The chefs need to be entertained.

data.title: will never look sashimi the same way
data.text:
If there is 10 star I would give 10 stars.

CAUTION: after Yume you will never look at sashimi the same way anymore, and is hard to enjoy sashimi at any other places. 

Not like some other expensive or fancy restaurant you pay extra for the experience or the amenity, at Yume every dollar goes into the food and the you can taste the process of how much detail work put into each slice before ends up in your mouth. 

A small family run place, they have the passion and care about customer's each bite unlike any other places. 

Experience is A+
Food quality A+
Price is reasonable for such amazing food art. we had double order of toro and eel, and reorder of the fluke, and sake. $300 after 25% tips.  

This is like trying A5 wagyu, I can't imagine how much better this could be over the top ribeyes, but once you had a bite, it opens up another level greatness! 

The tuna, and salmon I couldn't imagine how much better could it be compare to many other fresh sashimi places, and after yesterday I don't think I can eat cheap sashimi anymore....

For those who said this is not the best sushi in the bay I disagree, I'm can say I tried so many places not just in the bay including vegas and east coast, the other top sashimi can't even come close.

data.title: Best sushi
data.text:
I love the sushi here.  I always order "all fish" (no shells, just fish).  One major change on policy:  No more minimum # of headcount.  They will accommodate a maximum of 8 (since there's only 8 seating capacity in the bar).  Yay!  It's a 50/50 chef work between Hideki-san his son Andrew/Tsuyoshi-san.

Yoriko-san continues to be Ms Manner of the house.

ALWAYS an unforgettable experience. SUPERB sushi.  LOVE IT!

I will go back again, for sure!

data.title: Money hungry owners
data.text: I want to revise my last review and let everyone know that THIS PLACE HAS GONE DOWNHILL...the owners are clearly looking to cash in on what was once a good thing. I recently went as a party of three..and while the other two in my party were parking was kicked out by the wife for the 5pm seating at 5:06pm, even though I had been there since 4:30 and she had said it was fine as long as our party was fully present by 5:10pm ( they arrived at 5:08pm and the son admitted this). The son came out and blew me off but it was clear they were more interested in the larger party waiting behind me. This has been my favorite restaurant for the last couple of years but recently they've raised their prices, redecorated, and brought their son in ( who is not nearly as skilled as his father but presents a lot more attitude). Sad to say I will not be going back and I would strongly discourage anyone from eating here. We were very excited about their change in policy about allowing parties larger than two but it looks as though we'll never get the opportunity to experience this. I have no problem with the seemingly strict rules they enforce, but their lack of respect for their customers is definitely not something I appreciate. Yelling at me to get out of the restaurant even though my guests were there on the timeline they demanded is unacceptable.

data.title: Great Sushi!
data.text:
Loved Yume.  The sushi was fantastic and service was great. We let the chef choose for us. he Scottish Salmon was the best I have ever tasted. (We do not get Sushi like this in Montreal)
Got a kick out of seeing the owner tell some young clients to stop going downstairs for a smoke and eat their meal. If they didn't like it "don't come back". 
My next visit to Alameda I will go back .

data.title: The Sushi Nazi Runs the Place
data.text:
The reviews that compare this place to the "Soup Nazi" episode of Seinfeld are right on.  There are lots of unspoken rules and you get scolded.  

The sushi is certainly good, perhaps the best on Alameda Island.  But anybody who thinks it's the best in the Bay Area, or up there with the best, is hallucinating . . . or perhaps just not too well traveled.  I get the impression the clientele who still go are trying to be impressed with themselves for visiting this place.  Like other reviews have stated, there is a cult feel here with lots of posing.

Over the past year or so the "sushi Nazi" feel has gotten far worse, and now you can't go with a party of more two after 5:30.   Obviously they don't like children, since that's really the only purpose such a limitation serves (any group of more than two adults can simply split up).  That for me is the last straw, and I won't be back.  Kamakura around the corner is not quite as good, but it's cheaper and the owners and staff actually act like they want your business.  That is far more authentically Japanese, the sushi Nazi (and his wife) are just cranks.

I'll put my amateur psychoanalyst hat on and guess that the departure of their daughter, who used to work there, has driven them over the edge.  A sad fate to what was once a quirky and cool restaurant.

data.title: I believe this used to be sushi sue's
data.text: I believe this used to be sushi sue's

data.title: the restaurant reminds you of a sushi bar in tokyo!  it's small and they don't serve any party larger than 3 people...
data.text: the restaurant reminds you of a sushi bar in tokyo!  it's small and they don't serve any party larger than 3 people... they much prefer to serve party of 2 so it is not for big party or gathering.  my girlfriend and i had a good time and the sushi is the freshest in town or perhaps in the bay area!  let the sushi chef decides what you'll eat and take his recommendation.  it WON'T go wrong.  this is a place for real sushi snobs so if you are looking for teriyaki and other cooked japanese food  (or the crazy americanized rolls), try somewhere else!  if you solely want sushi, you are in for a real treat!

data.title: It's my favorite Jap rest b4,,,but it has been became popular and i think the food is not as fresh as b4,,,,this rest...
data.text: It's my favorite Jap rest b4,,,but it has been became popular and i think the food is not as fresh as b4,,,,this rest is owned by a Japanese couple and a helper in the kitchen,,,,only 12seats inside and dun serve for party over 4,,,(actually 3 is hard to serve too,,,,,)there's always a long line to wait start from 630pm,,,and they dun open on Sun&Mon,,,,no cell phone talking allowed inside....so i do really think it's kinda cool b4,,,,,but just u maynot really relax to sit inside to have dinner,,,,,,but the food is really gd to try esp the Uni/toro/mutsu~

data.title: El mejor sushi - punto
data.text: Te va a estropear experiencias pasadas y futuras de sushi. La calidad es inigualable y vas a probar frutos del mar de todo el mundo. Vale la pena cada dolar ya que es caro... pero el mejor.
